title: Variable ocean.tos.tavg-u-hm-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.tosga)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: This may differ from "surface temperature" in regions of sea ice or floating ice shelves. For models using conservative temperature as the prognostic field, they should report the top ocean layer as surface potential temperature, which is the same as surface in situ temperature.

title: Variable ocnBgchem.dpco2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.dpco2)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.
Processing notes: Difference between atmospheric and oceanic partial pressure of CO2 (positive meaning ocean > atmosphere)

title: Variable landIce.snc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (LImon.snc)
labels: mon landIce CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell."; ; "modeling_realm" was "landIce land";
Comment: Fraction of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

title: Variable atmos.tntd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.tntd)
Comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics. This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion

title: Variable land.raLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB (Emon.raLut)
Comment: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to autotrophic respiration on land (respiration by producers) [see rh for heterotrophic production]. Calculated on land-use tiles.
Long name: Autotrophic Respiration on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

title: Variable land.nLitterSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.nLitterSurf)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between 'fine' and 'coarse' is model dependent. 'Surface litter' means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
Long name: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)

title: Variable atmos.vtem.tavg-p39-hy-air.day.GLB (EdayZ.vtem)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v*, w*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).";
Comment: zonal mean; hence YZT
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:longitude: mean time: mean CMIP7:longitude: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.zfull.ti-al-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.zfull)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Height of full model levels above a reference ellipsoid. A reference ellipsoid is a mathematical figure that approximates the geoid. The geoid is a surface of constant geopotential with which mean sea level would coincide if the ocean were at rest. The ellipsoid is an approximation because the geoid is an irregular shape. A number of reference ellipsoids are defined for use in the field of geodesy. To specify which reference ellipsoid is being used, a grid_mapping variable should be attached to the data variable as described in Chapter 5.6 of the CF Convention.";
Comment: Provide only if altitude of full model levels is fixed

title: Variable land.sftlaf.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.sftlaf)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Fraction of horizontal land grid cell area occupied by lake.
Long name: Fraction of the Grid Cell Occupied by Lake
Processing notes: New area type 'lake_and_inland_sea': <https://github.com/cf-convention/vocabularies/issues/65>

title: Variable atmos.sftlf.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.sftlf)
labels: fx atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Percentage of the grid cell occupied by land (including lakes)";
Comment: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.
Long name: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
Processing notes: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

title: Variable land.sftgif.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.sftgif)
labels: fx land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)";
Comment: fraction of grid cell occupied by "permanent" ice (i.e., glaciers).
Processing notes: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

title: Variable land.rootd.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB (fx.rootd)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as *missing* where the land fraction is 0.";
Comment: report the maximum soil depth reachable by plant roots (if defined in model), i.e., the maximum soil depth from which they can extract moisture; report as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean CMIP7:area: mean where land,

title: Variable land.orog.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.orog)
labels: fx land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.";
Comment: height above the geoid; as defined here, "the geoid" is a surface of constant geopotential that, if the ocean were at rest, would coincide with mean sea level. Under this definition, the geoid changes as the mean volume of the ocean changes (e.g., due to glacial melt, or global warming of the ocean). Reported here is the height above the present-day geoid (0.0 over ocean).

title: Variable land.mrsofc.ti-u-hxy-lnd.fx.GLB (fx.mrsofc)
labels: fx land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The bulk water content retained by the soil at -33 J/kg of suction pressure, expressed as mass per unit land area; report as missing where there is no land";
Comment: reported "where land": divide the total water holding capacity of all the soil in the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell; reported as "missing" where the land fraction is 0.
Long name: Capacity of Soil to Store Water (Field Capacity)
Processing notes: This variable should exclude lake water and must refer to soil water only. CHANGE: processing clarified.

title: Variable atmos.lon.ti-u-hxys-u.fx.GLB (fx.lon)
Comment: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
Processing notes: Note that the CF convention and CMOR2 require that this field will be included in each file that contains a variable that is a function of the "site" dimension, so there is no need to save this field by itself. It is included here simply to indicate that longitudes should be stored for the site grid in each file written. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable landIce.lithk.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.lithk)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This variable identifies the thickness of a prescribed ice sheet. This information is relevant to better understand how different models treat ice. For models where an ice sheet is just orography + an ice sheet mask, the value should be set to zero. For models that explicitly resolve an ice sheet thickness, the thickness of the ice sheet should be provided.

title: Variable atmos.lat.ti-u-hxys-u.fx.GLB (fx.lat)
Comment: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.
Processing notes: the fx.lon comment also applies to latitude. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable land.depthsl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.depthsl)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total (cumulative) thickness of all soil layers. This is the sum of individual thicknesses of all soil layers.
Long name: Total (Cumulative) Thickness of All Soil Layers

title: Variable land.depthl.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.depthl)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Depth of lakes, if this quantity is present in the model. If computed via volume and area, then this is lake volume divided by lake area.
Long name: Depth of Lake Below the Surface

title: Variable land.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.areacellr)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "For river routing model, if grid differs from the atmospheric grid.";
Comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report river model variables (may be the same as for atmospheric variables). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of area integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).
Long name: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables

title: Variable atmos.areacell.ti-u-hxy-u.fx.GLB (fx.areacella)
labels: fx atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy."; ; "modeling_realm" was "atmos land";
Comment: Cell areas for any grid used to report atmospheric variables and any other variable using that grid (e.g., soil moisture content). These cell areas should be defined to enable exact calculation of global integrals (e.g., of vertical fluxes of energy at the surface and top of the atmosphere).
Long name: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
Processing notes: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

title: Variable atmos.zg.tavg-p19-hxy-air.day.GLB (day.zg)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "dimensions" was "longitude latitude plev8 time";
Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude plev8 time CMIP7:longitude latitude plev19 time, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where air,

title: Variable atmos.wbgt.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.wbgt2mmax)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: max 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WGBT): Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes. The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
Long name: maximum 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Processing notes: The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air, and "P = surface pressure in Pa"

title: Variable atmos.wbgt.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.wbgt2m)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature (WBGT). Wet Bulb Globe Temperature (WBGT) is a particularly effective indicator of heat stress for active populations such as outdoor workers and athletes. The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air and "P = surface pressure in Pa"
Long name: mean 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Processing notes: The calculation should be done with: WBGT = 0.567 \* T_C + 0.393 \* e/100 + 3.94, where T_C is temperature in degrees C, and e = huss \* p \* M_air / M_H2O, where "huss=specific humidity in kg/kg", M_H2O = 18.01528/1000 # kg/mol, M_air = 28.964/1000 # kg/mol for dry air, and "P = surface pressure in Pa"

title: Variable atmos.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.rsus)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

title: Variable atmos.noaahi2m.tmax-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.noaahi2mmax)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: max 2m daily NOAA heat index The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K. NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R) where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
Processing notes: NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2 where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

title: Variable atmos.noaahi2m.tavg-h2m-hxy-u.day.GLB (day.noaahi2m)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: mean 2m daily NOAA heat index. The perceived air temperature when relative humidity is taken into consideration (which makes it feel hotter than the actual air temperature). The heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K. NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523(T) + 10.14333127(R) - 0.22475541(T)(R) - 6.83783e-3 sqr(T) - 5.481717e-2 sqr(R) + 1.22874e-3 sqr(T) (R) + 8.5282e-4 (T) sqr(R) - 1.99e-6 sqr(T) sqr(R) where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%)
Processing notes: NOAA heat index = -42.379 + 2.04901523T + 10.14333127R - 0.22475541TR - 6.83783 x 10-3T2 - 5.481717 x 10-2R2 + 1.22874 x 10-3T2R + 8.5282 x 10-4TR2 - 1.99 x 10-6T2R2 where T is 2 m temperature (degrees F), R is relative humidity (%). Heat index is only defined when the ambient air temperature is at or above 299.817 K.

'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) snow mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

Comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
Long name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.snm.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sisndmassmelt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "the rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by sea-ice area"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)";
Comment: Rate of change of snow mass through melt divided by grid-cell area. Always negative or zero.
Long name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Melt
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.sisndmassdyn.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sisndmassdyn)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Rate of change of snow mass due to sea ice dynamics (advection, divergence, etc.) divided by grid-cell area.
Long name: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.snc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sisnconc)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "units" was "%"; ; "comment" was "Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by snow, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice . Exclude snow that lies on land or land ice."; ; "long_name" was "Snow Area Percentage";
Comment: Area fraction of the sea-ice surface that is covered by snow. In many models that do not explicitly resolve an areal fraction of snow, this variable will always be either 0 or 1.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

title: Variable ocnBgchem.sisi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sisi)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
Comment: Vertically-integrated amount of silicate in ice algae, expressed in moles of silicon per square meter of sea ice.
Long name: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sishearvel.tpt-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sishearvel)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant)"; ; "frequency" was "monPt"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) time: point";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) time: point
Comment: Maximum shear of sea-ice velocity field (second shear strain invariant). Requested as instantaneous value at the center of the month (i.e., first timestep of the 15th day of the month).
Long name: Maximum Shear of Sea-Ice Velocity Field
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.sisaltmass.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sisaltmass)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Mass of Salt in Sea Ice per Area"; ; "comment" was "Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.
Long name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice

title: Variable seaIce.sisali.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sisali)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "units" was "0.001"; ; "long_name" was "Sea Ice Salinity"; ; "comment" was "Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell";
Comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:0.001 CMIP7:1E-03, Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

title: Variable seaIce.sithick.tavg-u-hxy-sir.mon.GLB (SImon.sirdgthick)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice_ridges (comment: mask=sirdgconc)";
Comment: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice_ridges (comment: mask=sirdgconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice_ridges (mask=sirdgconc),

title: Variable seaIce.sirdgconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sirdgconc)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Ridging"; ; "comment" was "Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice ."; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "units" was "1";
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc), CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:1 CMIP7:%,

title: Variable seaIce.prra.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sipr)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "comment" was "mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area";
Comment: Mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area. If the rain is directly put into the ocean, it should not be counted towards sipr. Always positive or zero.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

Cell methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
Comment: Vertically-integrated amount of nitrate in ice algae, expressed in moles of nitrogen per square meter of sea ice.

Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.simpthick.tavg-u-hxy-simp.mon.GLB (SImon.simpthick)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Meltpond Mass per Unit Area (as Depth)"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)"; ; "comment" was "Meltpond Depth";
Comment: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.

Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by meltpond covered area"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice_melt_pond (comment: mask=simpconc)";
Comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.
Long name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond

Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. title: Variable seaIce.simpeffconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.simpeffconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.simpconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.simpconc)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "comment" was "Percentage of sea ice, by area, which is covered by melt ponds, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice ."; ; "long_name" was "Percentage Cover of Sea Ice by Meltpond";
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

title: Variable seaIce.simassacrossline.tavg-u-ht-u.mon.GLB (SImon.simassacrossline)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Sea Mass Area Flux Through Straits"; ; "comment" was "net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)";
Comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice mass transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

title: Variable seaIce.simass.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.simass)
labels: mon seaIce CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Sea-Ice Mass per Area"; ; "comment" was "Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area.

title: Variable seaIce.siitdthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siitdthick)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Sea-Ice Thickness in Thickness Categories"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)"; ; "comment" was "Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)";
Comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siitdconc),

title: Variable seaIce.siitdsnthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siitdsnthick)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Actual thickness of snow in each category (NOT volume divided by grid area), (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)";
Comment: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.
Long name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siitdconc),

CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories"; ; "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell covered by snow in each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc)";
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Snow Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siitdconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siitdconc),

title: Variable seaIce.siitdconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (SImon.siitdconc)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell covered by each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)"; ; "long_name" was "Sea-Ice Area Percentages in Thickness Categories";
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

title: Variable seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sihc)
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "sea_ice_temperature_expressed_as_heat_content"; ; "comment" was "Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water"; ; "long_name" was "Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

title: Variable ocnBgchem.sigpp.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sigpp)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Change in ice algal carbon mass due to photosynthesis per sea ice unit area per unit time.
Long name: Gross Primary Productivity in Sea Ice as Carbon Amount Flux
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Positive Direction - CMIP6:up CMIP7:down Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). title: Variable seaIce.siflsensbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siflsensbot)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "long_name" was "Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice"; ; "comment" was "the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean"; ; "positive" was "up";
Comment: Net sensible heat flux under sea ice from or to the ocean (energy flow per sea ice area). Per sign convention, heat from the ocean is counted as negative since it describes an upward heat flux.
Long name: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux under Sea Ice
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name, Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sfdsi.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siflsaltbot)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean.
Processing notes: Identical to the now-deprecated CMIP6 variable SImon.sfdsi Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.
Expression UKESM1: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY * aice) * REF_SALINITY / 1000.

title: Variable seaIce.siflfwdrain.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siflfwdrain)

This combines both surface melt water that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt pond. By definition, this flux is always positive."; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)";
Comment: Total flux of fresh water from sea-ice surface into underlying ocean divided by grid-cell area. This combines both surface meltwater that drains directly into the ocean and the drainage of surface melt ponds. By definition, this flux is always positive.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. title: Variable seaIce.siflfwbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.siflfwbot)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "comment" was "Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)";
Comment: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area. This flux is positive when fresh water enters the ocean, and is therefore negative during ice growth and positive during ice melt.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc)
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY)
Expression UKESM1: ((meltt + meltb + meltl - congel - frazil) * ICE_DENSITY + melts * SNOW_DENSITY) / (100. * SECONDS_IN_DAY)

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassth.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassth)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Total rate of change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area.

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassmelttop.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassmelttop)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting at the ice surface divided by grid-cell area. This number is independent of the actual fate of the meltwater, and will hence include all sea-ice meltwater that drains into the ocean and all sea-ice meltwater that is collected by a melt-pond parameterisation. Always negative or zero.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Surface Melting

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassmeltlat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassmeltlat)
CMIP6 Differences: "long_name" was "Lateral Sea Ice Melt Rate"; ; "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through lateral melting/dissolution divided by grid-cell area (report zero if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically). Always negative or zero.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting
Processing notes: CHANGE: name, renamed from SImon.sidmasslat in CMIP6 CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassmeltbot.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassmeltbot)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass through melting/dissolution at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always zero or negative since sea-ice growth is collected in sidmassgrowthbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassgrowthwat.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassgrowthwat)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Together, sidmassgrowthwat and sidmassgrowthbot should give total ice growth";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to sea ice formation in supercooled water (often through frazil formation) divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Growth in Supercooled Open Water (Frazil)

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassgrowthsi.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassgrowthsi)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Always positive or zero.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,

title: Variable seaIce.sidmassgrowthbot.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassgrowthbot)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass due to vertical growth of existing sea ice at its base divided by grid-cell area. Note that this number is always positive or zero since sea-ice melt is collected in sidmassmeltbot. This is to account for differential growth and melt in models with a sub-grid scale ice thickness distribution.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Basal Growth

title: Variable seaIce.evspsbl.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sidmassevapsubl)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area. If a model does not differentiate between the sublimation of snow and sea ice, we recommend to report sidmassevapsubl as zero as long as the ice is snow covered, and to report any sublimation within the variable sisndmasssubl.
Long name: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation

title: Variable seaIce.sicompstren.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sicompstren)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc)"; ; "comment" was "Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P (= P*h exp(-C(1-A)) where P* is compressive strength, h ice thickness, A compactness and C strength reduction constant).";
Comment: Computed strength of the ice pack, defined as the energy (J m-2) dissipated per unit area removed from the ice pack under compression, and assumed proportional to the change in potential energy caused by ridging. For Hibler-type models, this is P = P\* h exp(-C(1-A)) where P\* is compressive strength, h is ice thickness, A is compactness and C is strength reduction constant.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail. CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where sea_ice (comment: mask=siconc) CMIP7:area: time: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc),

(2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.mon.NH (SImon.siarean)

title: Variable seaIce.siareaacrossline.tavg-u-ht-u.mon.GLB (SImon.siareaacrossline)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)";
Comment: Net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean. Note that the definitions of the passages are for SIMIP purposes just meant as default values as given by the physical ocean MIP described in Griffies et al. (2016). Individual models might chose slightly different definitions as given by their grid geometry. 1. Fram Strait: (11.5W,81.3N) to (10.5E,79.6N). 2. Canadian Arctic Archipelago: (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N). 3. Barents Sea Opening: (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N). 4. Bering Strait: (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N).

title: Variable ocnBgchem.sialgc.tavg-u-hxy-si.mon.GLB (SImon.sialgc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea_ice (mask=siconc) depth: sum where sea_ice time: mean
Comment: Vertically-integrated content of carbon in ice algae, expressed as moles of carbon per square meter of sea ice.
Long name: Total Ice Algal Carbon Amount in Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH (SIday.sisnmasss)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present

Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice South

title: Variable seaIce.sisnmass.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH (SIday.sisnmassn)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total integrated mass of snow on sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere.
Long name: Snow Mass on Sea Ice North

title: Variable seaIce.sisnhc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.sisnhc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Heat content of all snow in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Snow-water equivalent at 0 C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. Does not include the heat content of sea ice.

title: Variable seaIce.sisaltmass.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB (SIday.sisaltmass)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the total mass of all salt in sea ice should be calculated from the salinity value used in the calculation of the salt budget.
Long name: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice
Processing notes: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

title: Variable seaIce.sisali.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.sisali)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mean sea-ice salinity of all sea ice in grid cell. Sometimes, models implicitly or explicitly assume a different salinity of the ice for thermodynamic considerations than they do for closing the salt budget with the ocean. In these cases, the mean salinity used in the calculation of the salt budget should be reported.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sithick.tavg-u-hxy-sir.day.GLB (SIday.sirdgthick)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total volume of ridged sea ice divided by area of ridges, i.e. mean thickness of ridged sea ice.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sirdgconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.sirdgconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is ridged sea ice.
Processing notes: Fraction of sea ice, by area, which is covered by sea ice ridges, giving equal weight to every square metre of sea ice.

title: Variable seaIce.simpthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.simpthick)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Average depth of melt ponds on sea ice, that is melt pond volume divided by melt pond area.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.simprefrozen.tavg-u-hxy-simp.day.GLB (SIday.simprefrozen)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Volume of refrozen ice on melt ponds divided by melt pond covered area.
Long name: Thickness of Refrozen Ice on Melt Pond
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.simpeffconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.simpeffconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by open melt ponds, that is melt ponds that are not covered by snow or ice lids. This represents the effective (i.e. radiatively-active) melt pond area fraction.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Effective Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.simpconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.simpconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of sea-ice surface that is covered by melt ponds.
Long name: Fraction of Sea Ice Covered by Melt Pond

title: Variable seaIce.siitdthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siitdthick)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each ice thickness category, NOT volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siitdsnthick.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siitdsnthick)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Actual thickness of snow in each ice thickness category, NOT snow volume divided by grid area (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis). It can also be derived by dividing the volume of snow by the area of snow in each thickness category.
Long name: Snow Thickness in Ice Thickness Categories
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siitdsnconc.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siitdsnconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by snow in each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).

title: Variable seaIce.siitdconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (SIday.siitdconc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Area fraction of grid cell covered by each ice thickness category (vector with one entry for each ice thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis).
Long name: Sea-Ice Area Fractions in Ice Thickness Categories

title: Variable seaIce.sihc.tavg-u-hxy-sea.day.GLB (SIday.sihc)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by grid-cell area. This includes both the latent and sensible heat content contributions. Water at 0C is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J. This variable does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine in the sea ice. Heat content is always negative since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water.

title: Variable seaIce.rsus.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflswutop)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Upward shortwave flux from the sea-ice surface to the atmosphere (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.
Long name: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.rsds.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflswdtop)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present

Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siflswdbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflswdbot)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present

(2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siflsenstop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflsenstop)

Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siflsensbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflsensbot)

(2016) for more detail.

(2016) for more detail.

CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Downwelling longwave flux from the atmosphere to the sea-ice surface (energy flow per sea ice area). Always positive or zero.

Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sifllattop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.sifllattop)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Net latent heat flux over sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siflcondtop.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflcondtop)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice surface, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the uppermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the surface of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.

Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siflcondbot.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siflcondbot)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Net heat conduction flux at the ice base, i.e. the conductive heat flux from the centre of the lowermost vertical sea-ice grid box to the base of the sea ice (energy flow per sea ice area). Positive for a downward heat flux.
Long name: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Sea Ice at the Base
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.sifb.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.sifb)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mean height of sea-ice surface (i.e. snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level. This follows the classical definition of freeboard for in situ observations. In the satellite community, sometimes the total height of sea ice and snow above sea level is referred to as freeboard. This can easily be calculated by adding sisnthick to sifb.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH (SIday.siextents)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total integrated area of all Southern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

title: Variable seaIce.siextent.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH (SIday.siextentn)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total integrated area of all Northern Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15% areal fraction of sea ice (siconc >= 0.15). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

title: Variable seaIce.siconca.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (SIday.siconca)
labels: day seaIce CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice";
Comment: Areal fraction of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the atmosphere grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.

title: Variable seaIce.siconc.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (SIday.siconc)
labels: day seaIce CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved_UKESM
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean where sea time: mean";
Comment: Areal fraction of a given grid cell that is covered by sea ice on the ocean grid, independent of the thickness of that ice.
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Units (from Physical Parameter) - CMIP6:% CMIP7:1, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: mean where sea time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time typesi CMIP7:longitude latitude time,

title: Variable seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.day.SH (SIday.siareas)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Southern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

title: Variable seaIce.siarea.tavg-u-hm-u.day.NH (SIday.siarean)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Total integrated area of sea ice in the Northern Hemisphere (where siconc > 0). Does not include grid cells partially covered by land.

title: Variable seaIce.siage.tavg-u-hxy-si.day.GLB (SIday.siage)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Age of sea ice since its formation in open water.
Processing notes: Note that SIMIP requests the area-weighted average for all intensive variables (i.e., variables that are not proportional to area fraction such as albedo, temperature, or heat flux). Hence, all time samples with non-zero sea-ice fraction are first multiplied by area fraction, then summed, and then divided by the sum of the area fractions. See Appendix C of Notz et al. (2016) for more detail.

title: Variable ocean.volcello.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.volcello)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "grid-cell volume ca. 2000.";
Cell methods: area: sum where sea time: mean
Comment: For oceans with more than 1 mesh (e.g. staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy. If this field is time-dependent then save it instead as one of your Omon and Odec fields
Processing notes: a 3-d field: For oceans with more than 1 mesh, report on grid that applies to temperature

title: Variable ocean.tnpeo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.tnpeo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.
Long name: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content

title: Variable ocean.tnkebto.tavg-u-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.tnkebto)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.
Long name: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection

title: Variable ocean.somint.tavg-u-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.somint)
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "integral_wrt_depth_of_product_of_sea_water_density_and_salinity"; ; "comment" was "Full column sum of density*cell thickness*prognostic salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Full column sum of density\*cell thickness\*salinity. If the model is Boussinesq, then use Boussinesq reference density for the density factor.
Long name: Depth Integral of Product of Sea Water Density and Prognostic Salinity

title: Variable ocean.rsdoabsorb.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.rsdoabsorb)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'shortwave' means shortwave radiation. 'Layer' means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be model_level_number, but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. Net absorbed radiation is the difference between absorbed and emitted radiation.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from penetrative shortwave radiation within a grid cell.
Long name: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer

title: Variable ocean.osalttend.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.osalttend)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.
Long name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.osaltrmadvect.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.osaltrmadvect)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'residual mean advection' refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from residual mean (sum of Eulerian mean + parameterized eddy-induced) advection.
Long name: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.dispkexyfo.tavg-u-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.dispkexyfo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.

title: Variable ocean.difvso.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.difvso)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic salinity field.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.difvho.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.difvho)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.diftrelo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.diftrelo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced diffusive transport oriented along neutral or isopycnal directions. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the neutral diffusivity or isopycnal diffusivity or Redi diffusivity.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.diftrblo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.diftrblo)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the 'thickness' diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called 'ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity'. The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.";
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Ocean tracer diffusivity associated with parameterized eddy-induced advective transport. Sometimes this diffusivity is called the "thickness" diffusivity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was called "ocean tracer bolus laplacian diffusivity". The CMIP6 name is physically more relevant.
Long name: Ocean Tracer Diffusivity Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.difmxylo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.difmxylo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.difmxybo.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.yr.GLB (Oyr.difmxybo)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Lateral biharmonic viscosity applied to the momentum equations.
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid. Online mapping to depth/pressure vertical grid if depth or pressure are not native.

title: Variable ocean.zostoga.tavg-u-hm-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.zostoga)
labels: mon ocean CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

Expression HadGEM3-GC31: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)
Expression UKESM1: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)
Expression UKESM1-3: calc_zostoga(thetao, thkcello, areacello, zfullo_0, so_0, rho_0_mean, deptho_0_mean)

title: Variable ocean.zossq.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.zossq)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Surface ocean geoid defines z=0.
Long name: Square of Sea Surface Height Above Geoid
Processing notes: Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

title: Variable ocean.zos.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.zos)
labels: mon ocean CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 BCV approved
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: This is the dynamic sea level, so should have zero global area mean. It should not include inverse barometer depressions from sea ice.
Processing notes: See OMDP document for details. Report on native horizontal grid as well as on a spherical latitude/longitude grid.

Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

title: Variable ocnBgchem.zmisc.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Omon.zmisc)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean

title: Variable ocnBgchem.zmicro.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.30S-90S (Omon.zmicroos)
