title: Variable atmos.tntscp.tpt-al-hxys-u.subhr.GLB (Esubhr.tntscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s03i181[lbproc=0] - m01s03i189[lbproc=0] + m01s04i141[lbproc=0] + m01s04i181[lbproc=0] + m01s16i161[lbproc=0] + m01s16i181[lbproc=0] + m01s01i181[lbproc=0] - m01s01i161[lbproc=0] + m01s02i181[lbproc=0] - m01s02i161[lbproc=0] + m01s05i181[lbproc=0] - m01s05i161[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s03i181[lbproc=0] - m01s03i189[lbproc=0] + m01s04i141[lbproc=0] + m01s04i181[lbproc=0] + m01s16i161[lbproc=0] + m01s16i181[lbproc=0] + m01s01i181[lbproc=0] - m01s01i161[lbproc=0] + m01s02i181[lbproc=0] - m01s02i161[lbproc=0] + m01s05i181[lbproc=0] - m01s05i161[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing

title: Variable atmos.tntd.tpt-al-hxys-u.subhr.GLB (Esubhr.tntd)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics. This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion

title: Variable atmos.tnhusscp.tpt-al-hxys-u.subhr.GLB (Esubhr.tnhusscp)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Specific' means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: alevel site time1
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s01i182[lbproc=0] + m01s02i182[lbproc=0] + m01s03i182[lbproc=0] - m01s03i190[lbproc=0] + m01s04i142[lbproc=0] + m01s04i182[lbproc=0] + m01s05i182[lbproc=0] - m01s05i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i182[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP
Expression UKESM1: (m01s01i182[lbproc=0] + m01s02i182[lbproc=0] + m01s03i182[lbproc=0] - m01s03i190[lbproc=0] + m01s04i142[lbproc=0] + m01s04i182[lbproc=0] + m01s05i182[lbproc=0] - m01s05i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i162[lbproc=0] + m01s16i182[lbproc=0]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.utendogw.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB (EmonZ.utendogw)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Zonal mean tendency of eastward wind induced by the parameterized orographic gravity wave drag
Long name: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). We ask that in the Essential Model Documentation modelling centers specify the parameterization scheme used and the specific values of its tunable parameters used for the simulation, and a specification of the part of the gravity wave spectrum that is targeted by the parameterization (e.g., minimally, the effective resolution of the model).

title: Variable atmos.tntmp.tavg-p39-hy-air.mon.GLB (EmonZ.tntmp)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "longitude: mean time: mean"; ; "comment" was "Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded. This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.";

Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

title: Variable atmos.tntscp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.tntscp)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name tendency_of_air_temperature_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain net latent heating effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation between water vapour, liquid or ice phases. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] - m01s03i189[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

Expression UKESM1: (m01s03i181[lbproc=128] - m01s03i189[lbproc=128] + m01s04i141[lbproc=128] + m01s04i181[lbproc=128] + m01s16i161[lbproc=128] + m01s16i181[lbproc=128] + m01s01i181[lbproc=128] - m01s01i161[lbproc=128] + m01s02i181[lbproc=128] - m01s02i161[lbproc=128] + m01s05i181[lbproc=128] - m01s05i161[lbproc=128]) / ATMOS_TIMESTEP

title: Variable atmos.tnhusscp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.tnhusscp)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'tendency_of_X' means derivative of X with respect to time. 'Specific' means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).";
Comment: The phrase "tendency_of_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Specific" means per unit mass. Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. A variable with the standard name of tendency_of_specific_humidity_due_to_stratiform_cloud_and_precipitation should contain the effects of all processes which convert stratiform clouds and precipitation to or from water vapor. In an atmosphere model, stratiform cloud is that produced by large-scale convergence (not the convection schemes).
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Clouds and Precipitation

Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe_thickness_of_X_amount or _content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

title: Variable land.rhc14.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.rhc14)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ('consumers'), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ('producers') do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.
Long name: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.rhc13.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.rhc13)

Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean

Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

title: Variable land.nppLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB (Emon.nppLut)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Production of carbon' means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ('producers'), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. 'Productivity' means production per unit area. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.";
Comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
Long name: Net Primary Production on Land-Use Tile as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

title: Variable land.npp.tavg-u-hxy-ng.mon.GLB (Emon.nppGrass)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac)";
Comment: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell
Long name: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (comment: mask=grassFrac) CMIP7:area: time: mean where natural_grasses (mask=grassFrac),

title: Variable land.netAtmosLandCO2Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.netAtmosLandCO2Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
Long name: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.netAtmosLandC14Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.netAtmosLandC14Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).
Long name: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.netAtmosLandC13Flux.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.netAtmosLandC13Flux)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral_carbon_transfer_over_land term, see below, will be zero data).-
Long name: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.nep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.nep)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire. Positive flux is into the land. Emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change)."; ; "long_name" was "Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]";

title: Variable land.nLitterSubSurf.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.nLitterSubSurf)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood_debris_mass_content_of_nitrogen, surface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen and subsurface_litter_mass_content_of_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.
Long name: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)

In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";

title: Variable ocnBgchem.fg14co2.tavg-u-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Emon.fg14co2)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Gas exchange flux of carbon-14 as CO2 (positive into ocean)
Long name: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fVegSoilSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fVegSoilSenescence)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

title: Variable land.fVegSoilMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fVegSoilMortality)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality

title: Variable land.fVegLitterSenescence.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fVegLitterSenescence)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence

title: Variable land.fVegLitterMortality.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fVegLitterMortality)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality
Long name: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality

title: Variable land.fVegFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fVegFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fProductDecomp.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fProductDecomp)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of 'forestry and agricultural products' are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.
Long name: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fNup.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNup)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere. ";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The uptake of nitrogen by fixation: nitrogen fixation means the uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere.
Long name: Total Plant Nitrogen Uptake (Sum of Ammonium and Nitrate) Irrespective of the Source of Nitrogen

title: Variable land.fNnetmin.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNnetmin)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.
Long name: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation

title: Variable land.fNloss.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNloss)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)

title: Variable land.fNleach.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNleach)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase 'due_to_' process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. 'Leaching' means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, 'runoff' refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase "due_to_" process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Leaching" means the loss of water soluble chemical species from soil. Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Loss to Leaching or Runoff (Sum of Ammonium, Nitrite and Nitrate)

title: Variable land.fNgasNonFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNgasNonFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to all processes other than fire
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from All Processes Except Fire

title: Variable land.fNgasFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNgasFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire

title: Variable land.fNgas.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNgas)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)

title: Variable land.fNfert.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNfert)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total Nitrogen added for cropland fertilisation (artificial and manure). Relative to total land area of a grid cell, not relative to agricultural area
Long name: Total Nitrogen Added for Cropland Fertilisation (Artificial and Manure)

title: Variable land.fNdep.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNdep)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Surface deposition rate of nitrogen.
Long name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land

title: Variable land.fNVegSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNVegSoil)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In some models part of nitrogen (e.g., root exudate) can go directly into the soil pool without entering litter.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation Directly to Soil

title: Variable land.fNVegLitter.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNVegLitter)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter

title: Variable land.fNProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change

title: Variable land.fNOx.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNOx)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'Upward' indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The phrase 'expressed_as' is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. 'Nox' means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. 'Vegetation' means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

title: Variable land.fNLitterSoil.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNLitterSoil)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. 'Litter' is dead plant material in or above the soil.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.
Long name: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil

title: Variable land.fNLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNLandToOcean)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Long name: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

title: Variable land.fNAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fNAnthDisturb)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: will require some careful definition to make sure we capture everything - any human activity that releases nitrogen from land instead of into product pool goes here. E.g. Deforestation fire, harvest assumed to decompose straight away, grazing...
Long name: Nitrogen Mass Flux out of Land Due to any Human Activity

title: Variable land.fN2O.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fN2O)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Surface upward flux of nitrous oxide (N2O) from vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil.

title: Variable land.fLulccAtmLut.tavg-u-hxy-multi.mon.GLB (Emon.fLulccAtmLut)
Comment: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities. Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere
Long name: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude landUse time CMIP7:longitude latitude landuse time,

title: Variable land.fLuc.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fLuc)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to human changes to land (excluding forest regrowth) accounting possibly for different time-scales related to fate of the wood, for example.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere due to Land Use Change
Long name: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fLitterFire.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fLitterFire)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fHarvestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fHarvestToProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here
Long name: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool

title: Variable land.fHarvestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fHarvestToAtmos)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: any harvested carbon that is assumed to decompose immediately into the atmosphere is reported here
Long name: Harvested Biomass That Goes Straight into Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fFireNat.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fFireNat)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: CO2 emissions from natural fires
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fFireAll.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fFireAll)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: From all sources, Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fDeforestToProduct.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fDeforestToProduct)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change

title: Variable land.fDeforestToAtmos.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fDeforestToAtmos)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.
Long name: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable land.fCLandToOcean.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fCLandToOcean)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.
Long name: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean

title: Variable land.fBNF.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fBNF)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

title: Variable land.fAnthDisturb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.fAnthDisturb)
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.
Long name: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable ocnBgchem.expcalc.tavg-ol-hxy-sea.mon.GLB (Emon.expcalc)
Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Downward flux of Calcite
Processing notes: Those who wish to record vertical velocities and vertical fluxes on ocean half-levels may do so. If using CMOR3 you will be required to specify artificial bounds (e.g. located at full model levels) to avoid an error exit.

title: Variable land.evspsblpot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.mon.GLB (Emon.evspsblpot)
labels: mon land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved

Cell methods: area: mean where sea time: mean
Comment: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

labels: mon aerosol CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved

labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved

title: Variable atmos.clmisr.tavg-h16-hxy-air.mon.GLB (Emon.clmisr)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Cloud percentage in spectral bands and layers as observed by the Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) instrument. The first layer in each profile is reserved for a retrieval error flag."; ; "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Comment: MISR cloud area fraction
Long name: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)

labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved

title: Variable atmos.cldnvi.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (Emon.cldnvi)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

title: Variable atmos.cldncl.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GLB (Emon.cldncl)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Cell methods: area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

title: Variable atmos.cldnci.tavg-u-hxy-cl.mon.GLB (Emon.cldnci)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing ice topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
Comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing ice topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

Processing notes: This is the total tendency due to parameterized orographic gravity wave drag, which is the sum of all possible components of the parameterization (where applicable). Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean."; ; "standard_name" was "number_concentration_of_stratiform_cloud_liquid_water_particle_at_stratiform_liquid_water_cloud_top";
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. Report concentration "as seen from space" over stratiform liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where stratiform_cloud,

title: Variable land.nppVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB (Eday.nppVgt)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed_as" is used in the construction A_expressed_as_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.
Long name: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

Comment: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass_weighted_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static_energy per mass unit)
Long name: Vertically Integrated Eastward Dry Static Energy Transport

title: Variable atmos.hurs.tmin-h2m-hxy-crp.day.GLB (Eday.hursminCrop)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time height2m"; ; "cell_methods" was "area: mean where crops time: minimum";
Cell methods: area: mean where crops time: minimum
Comment: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
Long name: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Relative Humidity over Crop Tile

title: Variable atmos.hfdsnb.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.hfdsnb)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Heat flux from snow into the ice or land under the snow.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Downward heat flux at snow botton
Long name: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base

title: Variable landIce.hfdsn.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.hfdsn)
labels: day landIce CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as 0.0 for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0."; ; "modeling_realm" was "landIce land";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Downward heat flux at snow top
Long name: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land

title: Variable land.gppVgt.tavg-u-hxy-multi.day.GLB (Eday.gppVgt)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production. Reported on land-use tiles.
Long name: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]

title: Variable atmosChem.flashrate.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.flashrate)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Lightning Flash Rate
Processing notes: frequency of lightning flashes per unit area

title: Variable land.evspsblveg.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.evspsblveg)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: The same as the current variable evspsblveg but defined on daily timescales.
Long name: Daily water evaporation flux from canopy

title: Variable land.evspsblsoi.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.evspsblsoi)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Water evaporation flux from soil but for daily averages i.e., the evspsblsoi variable, which is only currently defined for monthly averages
Long name: Daily water evaporation flux from soil

title: Variable land.evspsblpot.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.evspsblpot)
labels: day land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "at surface; potential flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: water_potential_evapotranspiration_flux

title: Variable atmos.evspsbl.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.evspsbl)
labels: day land CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

title: Variable land.esn.tavg-u-hxy-sn.day.GLB (Eday.esn)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Water here means water in all phases. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called 'sublimation'.) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. Unless indicated in the cell_methods attribute, a quantity is assumed to apply to the whole area of each horizontal grid box. Previously, the qualifier where_type was used to specify that the quantity applies only to the part of the grid box of the named type. Names containing the where_type qualifier are deprecated and newly created data should use the cell_methods attribute to indicate the horizontal area to which the quantity applies.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: liquid_water_evaporation_flux_from_surface_snow

title: Variable land.dsw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.dsw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'land_water_amount', often known as 'Terrestrial Water Storage', includes: surface liquid water (water in rivers, wetlands, lakes, reservoirs, rainfall intercepted by the canopy); surface ice and snow (glaciers, ice caps, grounded ice sheets not displacing sea water, river and lake ice, other surface ice such as frozen flood water, snow lying on the surface and intercepted by the canopy); subsurface water (liquid and frozen soil water, groundwater).";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Change in Surface Water Storage

title: Variable land.dsn.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.dsn)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Change in time of the mass per unit area of ice in glaciers, ice caps, ice sheets and shelves, river and lake ice, any other ice on a land surface, such as frozen flood water, and snow lying on such ice or on the land surface.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Change in Snow Water Equivalent

title: Variable land.dslw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.dslw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Content' indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including 'content_of_soil_layer' are used. 'Water' means water in all phases.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Change in Soil Moisture

title: Variable land.drivw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.drivw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Change over time of the mass of water per unit area in the fluvial system (stream and floodplain).";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Change in River Storage

title: Variable land.dgw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.dgw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Groundwater is subsurface water below the depth of the water table.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: change_over_time_in_groundwater

title: Variable land.dcw.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.dcw)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "The phrase 'change_over_time_in_X' means change in a quantity X over a time-interval, which should be defined by the bounds of the time coordinate. 'Canopy' means the plant or vegetation canopy. Canopy water is the water on the canopy. 'Water' means water in all phases, including frozen, i.e. ice and snow. 'Amount' means mass per unit area.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: change_over_time_in_canopy_water_amount

title: Variable atmos.clwvic.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.clwvic)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.clt.tavg-u-hxy-lnd.day.GLB (Eday.clt)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.";
Cell methods: area: mean where land time: mean
Comment: Total cloud fraction

title: Variable atmos.clivic.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.clivic)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

title: Variable atmos.cldnvi.tavg-u-hxy-u.day.GLB (Eday.cldnvi)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

title: Variable atmos.cldnci.tavg-u-hxy-cl.day.GLB (Eday.cldnci)
Cell methods: area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing ice topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
Comment: Concentration 'as seen from space' over ice-cloud portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with ice cloud or, if available, it is the sum over all ice cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total ice cloud top fraction (as seen from TOA) of each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Ice Crystal Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing ice topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

title: Variable aerosol.ccldncl.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB (Eday.ccldncl)
labels: day atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "number_concentration_of_convective_cloud_liquid_water_particle_at_convective_liquid_water_cloud_top";
Cell methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere)
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.
Long name: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (mean over the portion of the cell containing liquid topped cloud, as seen from top of atmosphere),

CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "1hrCM";
Cell methods: area: mean time: mean within days time: mean over days
Comment: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: mean_diurnal_cycle(m01s02i206[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] + m01s03i332[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] - m01s02i205[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24])
Expression HadGEM3-GC5: mean_diurnal_cycle(m01s02i206[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] + m01s03i332[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] - m01s02i205[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24])
Expression UKESM1: mean_diurnal_cycle(m01s02i206[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] + m01s03i332[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] - m01s02i205[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24])
Expression UKESM1-3: mean_diurnal_cycle(m01s02i206[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] + m01s03i332[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24] - m01s02i205[lbproc=128, lbtim_ia=24])

Comment: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

It does not mean 'net upward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics."; ; "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

title: Variable atmos.fco2nat.tpt-u-hxys-u.subhr.GLB (CFsubhr.fco2nat)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt"; ; "comment" was "This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid). This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land (nep) or ocean (fgco2) reservoirs.";
Comment: This is what the atmosphere sees (on its own grid). This field should be equivalent to the combined natural fluxes of carbon (requested in the L_mon and O_mon tables) that account for natural exchanges between the atmosphere and land or ocean reservoirs (i.e., "net ecosystem biospheric productivity", for land, and "air to sea CO2 flux", for ocean.)
Long name: Surface Carbon Mass Flux into the Atmosphere Due to Natural Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

title: Variable atmos.cct.tpt-u-hxys-u.subhr.GLB (CFsubhr.cct)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "subhrPt";
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Processing notes: This table includes the 2-D variables listed in the "Amon" spreadsheet, omitting, however, the daily maximum and minimum temperatures. All variables should be reported as synoptic fields, not daily means.

title: Variable atmos.tntmp.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.tntmp)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded. This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.";
Comment: This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded. This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.
Long name: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics

title: Variable atmos.tnhusd.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.tnhusd)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Tendency of specific humidity due to numerical diffusion.This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics. This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.";
Comment: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical moisture diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics. For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics. This term is required to check the closure of the moisture budget.
Long name: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Numerical Diffusion

title: Variable atmos.mcu.tavg-alh-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.mcu)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.";
Comment: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.dmc.tavg-alh-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.dmc)
Comment: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components. This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).
Processing notes: Report on model half-levels (i.e., model layer bounds and not standard pressures).

title: Variable atmos.clwvimodis.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clwvimodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column) as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator.

title: Variable atmos.clws.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clws)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water

title: Variable atmos.clwc.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clwc)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell. This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Long name: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water

title: Variable atmos.cltisccp.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.cltisccp)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud. (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.cltcalipso.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.cltcalipso)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the Cloud-Aerosol Lidar and Infrared Pathfinder Satellite Observation (CALIPSO) instrument. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.cls.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.cls)
labels: mon atmos CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisliquidReff.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisliquidReff)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of LWP (cloud liquid water path) and r_eff (droplet effective radius). The effective radius bin edges are defined in the COSP simulator (see lines 134-152 of cosp_config.F90: <https://github.com/CFMIP/COSPv2.0/blob/master/src/cosp_config.F90>)
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 LWP levels x 6 effective radius levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisliquid.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisliquid)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage liquid-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by clisccp (ISCCP simulator).
Long name: MODIS Liquid Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodisiceReff.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisiceReff)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of cloud IWP (cloud ice water path) and r_eff (effective droplet size). The effective radius bin edges are defined in the COSP simulator (see lines 134-152 of cosp_config.F90: <https://github.com/CFMIP/COSPv2.0/blob/master/src/cosp_config.F90>)
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 IWP levels x 6 effective radius levels. Metric is further described in [Pincus 2023](https://essd.copernicus.org/articles/15/2483/2023/essd-15-2483-2023-discussion.html)

title: Variable atmos.clmodisice.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodisice)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage ice-cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same as used by clisccp output from the ISCCP satellite simulator.
Long name: MODIS Ice Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels.

title: Variable atmos.clmodis.tavg-p7c-hxy-air.mon.GLB (CFmon.clmodis)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Percentage of total cloud cover in optical depth categories, as seen by the MODIS instrument simulator. Dimensions of tau (optical depth) and cloud-top pressure are the same used by the ISCCP instrument simulator. This is the equivalent MODIS version of the ISCCP _clisccp _variable.
Processing notes: 7 pressure levels x 7 optical depth levels (x latitude x longitude x time).

title: Variable atmos.cct.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB (CFday.cct)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area),

title: Variable atmos.ccb.tavg-u-hxy-ccl.day.GLB (CFday.ccb)
CMIP6 Differences: "cell_methods" was "area: time: mean";
Cell methods: area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area)
Comment: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.
Long name: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Cell Methods - CMIP6:area: time: mean CMIP7:area: time: mean where convective_cloud (weighted by total convective cloud area),

title: Variable atmos.rlds.tpt-u-hxy-u.3hr.GLB (CF3hr.rlds)
CMIP6 Differences: "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "comment" was "The surface called 'surface' means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. 'longwave' means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean 'net downward'. When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called 'irradiance'. In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called 'vector irradiance'. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, 'flux' implies per unit area, called 'flux density' in physics.";
Comment: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell."; ; "frequency" was "3hrPt"; ; "standard_name" was "effective_radius_of_stratiform_cloud_liquid_water_particle";
Cell methods: area: mean where stratiform_cloud time: point
Comment: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).
Long name: Stratiform Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius

title: Variable aerosol.tropoz.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.tropoz)

Comment: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp).

title: Variable atmosChem.tropo3ste.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.tropo3ste)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone in the troposphere. It represents the ozone volume mixing ratio in the troposphere that is considered to be stratospheric in origin. It should be consistent with the definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere and non-zero positive values in the troposphere.
Long name: Tropospheric ozone volume mixing ratio due to stratosphere-troposphere exchange (STE)

title: Variable atmosChem.tropdo3chm.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.tropdo3chm)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the net chemical tendency of ozone in the troposphere. The distinction between the stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the definition of the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Net Chemistry Tendency of O3 in troposphere

title: Variable atmosChem.tropch4lossoh.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.tropch4lossoh)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane due to reaction with the hydroxy (OH) radical. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Tropospheric loss of methane by OH

title: Variable atmosChem.tropch4loss.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.tropch4loss)
CMIP6 Differences: Not present
Comment: This is the loss rate of tropospheric methane by all chemical destruction. The distinction between stratosphere and troposphere should be consistent with the tropopause used in the calculation of the tropopause pressure (ptp). It should have zero values in the stratosphere.
Long name: Loss of Tropospheric Methane by all chemical destruction

labels: mon aerosol CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
CMIP6 Differences: "standard_name" was "effective_radius_of_cloud_liquid_water_particle_at_liquid_water_cloud_top"; ; "comment" was "Droplets are liquid only. This is the effective radius as seen from space over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere (TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.";
Comment: Droplets are liquid only. This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere.TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Expression HadGEM3-GC31: m01s02i285[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=3, lbproc=128]
Expression HadGEM3-GC5: m01s02i285[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=3, lbproc=128]
Expression UKESM1: m01s02i285[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=3, lbproc=128]
Expression UKESM1-3: m01s02i285[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=3, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=3, lbproc=128]

title: Variable aerosol.od443aer.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.od443aer)

CMIP6 Differences: "dimensions" was "longitude latitude time"; ; "comment" was "AOD from the ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water). Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute 'wavelength: 440nm'"; ; "long_name" was "Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 440nm";
Comment: This is the aerosol optical depth (AOD) from the ambient aerosls (i.e., includes aerosol water). Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 443 nm"
Processing notes: CHANGE SINCE CMIP6 in Dimensions - CMIP6:longitude latitude time CMIP7:longitude latitude time lambda443nm, CHANGE SINCE CMIP6: compound name,
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: m01s02i285[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=2, lbproc=128]
Expression UKESM1: m01s02i285[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i300[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i301[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i302[lbplev=2, lbproc=128] + m01s02i303[lbplev=2, lbproc=128]

title: Variable aerosol.mmraerh2o.tavg-al-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.mmraerh2o)
CMIP6 Differences: "comment" was "Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). 'Aerosol' means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. 'Ambient_aerosol' means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. 'Ambient aerosol particles' are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.";
Comment: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass_fraction_of_X_in_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

title: Variable aerosol.emivoc.tavg-u-hxy-u.mon.GLB (AERmon.emivoc)
labels: mon aerosol CMIP6 UKESM1 HadGEM3-GC31 approved
Comment: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field. _If_ fixed molecular weight of NMVOC is not available in model, please provide in units of kilomole m-2 s-1 (i.e. kg m-2 s-1 as if model NMVOC had molecular weight of 1) and add a comment to your file.
Expression HadGEM3-GC31: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C
Expression HadGEM3-GC5: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C
Expression UKESM1: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C
Expression UKESM1-3: ((m01s50i159[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_HCHO) + (m01s50i160[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C2H6)) + (m01s50i161[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_C3H8)) + (m01s50i162[lbproc=128] * (3.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ME2CO)) + (m01s50i163[lbproc=128] * (2.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MECHO)) + (m01s50i212[lbproc=128] / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MEOH) + (m01s50i300[lbproc=128] * (5.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_ISOPRENE)) + (m01s50i301[lbproc=128] * (10.0 / MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_MONOTERPENE))) * ATOMIC_MASS_OF_C

Comment: Direct primary emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Expression HadGEM3-GC31: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, m01s38i201[lbproc=128] + m01s38i202[lbproc=128] + m01s38i203[lbproc=128], sumlev='True', areadiv='True')
Expression HadGEM3-GC5: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, m01s38i201[lbproc=128] + m01s38i202[lbproc=128] + m01s38i203[lbproc=128], sumlev='True', areadiv='True')
Expression UKESM1: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, m01s38i201[lbproc=128] + m01s38i202[lbproc=128] + m01s38i203[lbproc=128], sumlev='True', areadiv='True')
Expression UKESM1-3: achem_emdrywet(MOLECULAR_MASS_OF_SO4, m01s38i201[lbproc=128] + m01s38i202[lbproc=128] + m01s38i203[lbproc=128], sumlev='True', areadiv='True')
